arguments.argument: Stronger hate speech laws would protect marginalized communities from harm.
Freedom of speech should not include incitement of violence or discrimination.
Other democratic countries have effective hate speech laws.
Online hate speech has led to real-world violence and must be regulated.
Expanding hate speech laws would create a more inclusive society.
Hate speech can cause psychological harm to targeted individuals.
Stronger laws would hold individuals accountable for spreading hate.
Hate speech laws ensure a balance between free speech and public safety.
Words have consequences, and legal measures can help prevent harm.
Social media companies should be legally required to remove hate speech.
Expanding hate speech laws could limit free speech rights.
Defining hate speech is subjective and open to abuse.
Current laws against incitement and threats are already sufficient.
Restricting speech could lead to government overreach and censorship.
People should be free to express controversial opinions without fear of punishment.
Banning hate speech does not eliminate hateful beliefs.
Some people may misuse hate speech laws to silence political opponents.
The First Amendment protects even unpopular and offensive speech.
Enforcing hate speech laws could be expensive and difficult.
Encouraging counter-speech is a better solution than legal restrictions.
